Package game.modes

Interface SimulationI

All Known Implementing Classes:
AutomaticMode, ManualMode, Simulation
public interface SimulationI
Interface defining the structure and behavior of a simulation. It provides methods for player movement, game state management, and access to key elements of the simulation such as the battlefield, player, enemies, and missions.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void game()
    Executes the main game logic for the simulation.
    CustomNetwork<Room> getBattleField()
    Retrieves the battlefield of the current simulation.
    ScenarioNr getCurrentScenario()
    Retrieves the current scenario of the simulation.
    Turn getCurrentTurn()
    Retrieves the current turn in the simulation.
    LinkedList<Enemy> getEnemies()
    Retrieves the list of enemies within the simulation.
    Mission getMission()
    Retrieves the mission associated with the simulation.
    Room getNextObjective()
    Retrieves the next objective room in the simulation.
    Player getPlayer()
    Retrieves the player object associated with the current simulation.
    boolean isGameOver()
    Checks whether the game is over.
    boolean isReturningToExit()
    Determines whether the player is currently returning to the entry point or designated exit in the simulation.
    void movePlayer()
    Moves the player to the next location in the simulation based on the current game state and objectives.
    void setEntryPoint​(Room entryPoint)
    Sets the entry point of the simulation to the specified room.
    void setGameOver​(boolean gameOver)
    Sets the game's over state.
    void setNextObjective​(Room nextObjective)
    Sets the next objective room in the simulation.

  • Method Details

    • movePlayer

      void movePlayer() throws ElementNotFoundException, EmptyCollectionException
      Moves the player to the next location in the simulation based on the current game state and objectives. This method handles the logic for updating the player's position and interacting with the game elements such as rooms, items, and enemies.
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if the required element, such as a room or path, is not found during the operation.
      EmptyCollectionException - if the collection of elements needed to perform the move is empty.

    • game

      void game() throws ElementNotFoundException, EmptyCollectionException
      Executes the main game logic for the simulation. This method is responsible for managing the overall progression of the game, coordinating player interactions, handling game states, and invoking any necessary sub-processes to advance the simulation. It may involve interactions with the battlefield, enemies, objectives, and other game elements.
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if an expected element within the game or simulation cannot be found, such as a missing enemy, item, or objective.
      EmptyCollectionException - if a required collection, such as a list of enemies or items, is empty during a critical operation.

    • isReturningToExit

      boolean isReturningToExit()
      Determines whether the player is currently returning to the entry point or designated exit in the simulation.
      Returns:
      true if the player is returning to the exit, false otherwise

    • isGameOver

      boolean isGameOver()
      Checks whether the game is over.
      Returns:
      true if the game has ended, otherwise false.

    • getBattleField

      CustomNetwork<Room> getBattleField()
      Retrieves the battlefield of the current simulation. The battlefield is represented as a custom network structure containing rooms, where rooms serve as nodes in the network. This method provides access to the underlying representation of the simulated battlefield.
      Returns:
      a CustomNetwork of type Room representing the battlefield

    • getEnemies

      LinkedList<Enemy> getEnemies()
      Retrieves the list of enemies within the simulation.
      Returns:
      a LinkedList containing Enemy objects representing the current enemies in the simulation

    • getPlayer

      Player getPlayer()
      Retrieves the player object associated with the current simulation.
      Returns:
      the Player instance representing the current player in the simulation

    • getMission

      Mission getMission()
      Retrieves the mission associated with the simulation.
      Returns:
      the current mission of the simulation, encapsulating the objectives, battlefield, and entities involved.

    • getNextObjective

      Room getNextObjective()
      Retrieves the next objective room in the simulation. The next objective represents the location or point of interest that the player should navigate towards to progress in the game or simulation. This may be defined by game logic or the current mission.
      Returns:
      the next objective as a Room object, or null if no objective is set

    • getCurrentTurn

      Turn getCurrentTurn()
      Retrieves the current turn in the simulation.
      Returns:
      the current turn, represented as a value of the Turn enum. It indicates whether it is currently the player's turn (Turn.PLAYER) or the enemy's turn (Turn.ENEMY) in the game flow.

    • getCurrentScenario

      ScenarioNr getCurrentScenario()
      Retrieves the current scenario of the simulation.
      Returns:
      the current scenario of type ScenarioNr, representing the active state or phase of the simulation.

    • setGameOver

      void setGameOver​(boolean gameOver)
      Sets the game's over state.
      Parameters:
      gameOver - a boolean value representing the new game over state. Set to true if the game is over, otherwise false.

    • setEntryPoint

      void setEntryPoint​(Room entryPoint)
      Sets the entry point of the simulation to the specified room.
      Parameters:
      entryPoint - the Room object representing the starting point of the simulation

    • setNextObjective

      void setNextObjective​(Room nextObjective)
      Sets the next objective room in the simulation.
      Parameters:
      nextObjective - the next Room to be designated as the objective
